title: No children nodes listed when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
OB: After creating a new data set without an SQL statement, when changing the data source to one that has no database/table/column information, no children nodes are listed in the data set editor page of the query tab. Upon closing and reopening the data set editor, the issue persists.
EB: When changing the data source for a data set, the children nodes of the new data source should be listed out.
SR:
1. Open the data set editor page of the query tab.
2. Create a new data set without an SQL statement.
3. Change the data source for the data set to one that has no database/table/column information.
4. Observe that no children nodes are listed.
5. Close the data set editor.
6. Reopen the data set editor.
7. Observe that the issue persists.
